a: HTML 錨點（Anchor）元素 (<a>) 定義一個網頁超連結，一個開啟超連結的目的名稱，或者兩者都有。
abbr: HTML 縮寫（Abbreviation）元素 (<abbr>) 是用來表現一個縮寫，並可選擇是否要提供這個縮寫的完整描述。如果出現這項元素，則 title 屬性必須專門用以標註它的完整描述。
address: The HTML Address Element (<address>) may be used by authors to supply contact information for its nearest <article> or <body> ancestor; in the latter case, it applies to the whole document.
area: The HTML Area element (<area>) defines a hot-spot region on an image, and optionally associates it with a hypertext link. This element is used only within a <map> element.
article: HTML 文章元素 (<article>) 是在整份文件、頁面、應用程式或站台中，用來個別標註當中的一則文章，且這份文章是適合被獨立傳播或再利用的，譬如像是被收錄在 syndication 文件裡的項目。它可以是論壇的一則訊息、一篇雜誌或報紙的文章、一篇網誌、一段使用者發表的意見、一個互動的元件，或者是任何獨立的內容項目。
aside: The HTML Aside Element (<aside>) represents a section of a page that consists of content that is tangentially related to the content around it, which could be considered separate from that content. Such sections are often represented as sidebars or as inserts; they often contain side explanation like a glossary definition, more loosely related stuff like advertisements, the biography of the author, or in web-applications, profile information or related blog links.
audio: audio 元素用於HTML 或 XHTML 文件中嵌入音軌。audio 元素已列入HTML5。
b: HTML B （粗體）元素 (<b>) 代表一段樣式和普通文字有所區別的文字，但不一定代表有特殊的重要性。它通常用在摘要中的關鍵字上，評測文章中的產品名稱，或者任何一段需要以粗體呈現的文字。另一個範例是用來識別文章每個段落的第一句。
base: The HTML Base element (<base>) specifies the base URL to use for all relative URLs contained within a document.
bdi: HTML 雙向隔離（Bi-directional Isolation ）元素 (<bdi>) 分隔出一段排列方向格式和其外不同的文字。
bdo: The HTML Bidirectional Override Element (<bdo>) is used to override the current directionality of text. It causes the directionality of the characters to be ignored in favor of the specified directionality.
blockquote: The HTML Block Quotation (<blockquote>) element indicates that the enclosed text is an extended quotation. Usually, this is rendered visually by indentation (see Notes for how to change it). A URL for the source of the quotation may be given using the cite attribute, while a text representation of the source can be given using the <cite> element.
body: HTML的Body （<body>）元素代表HTML文件中的主要內容。在檔案中只會有一個 <body> 元素 。
br: HTML Line Break 元素（<br>）在文字中產生換行（確認鍵）。常用於作詩或寫地址這些需要分行的類型。
canvas: The Canvas (<canvas>) HTML element can be used to draw graphics via scripting (usually JavaScript). For example, it can be used to draw graphs, make photo compositions or even perform animations.
caption: The HTML Table Caption Element (<caption>) represents the title of a table. Though it is always the first descendant of a <table>, its styling, using CSS, may place it elsewhere, relative to the table.
cite: The HTML Citation Element (<cite>) contains the title of a work, such as a book, song, movie, TV show, sculpture, etc.
code: The HTML Code Element (<code>) represents a fragment of computer code. By default, it is displayed in the browser's default monospace font.
col: The HTML Table Column Element (<col>) defines a column within a table and is used for defining common semantic on all common cells. It is generally found within a <colgroup> element.
colgroup: HTML 表格欄群組元件(Column Group Element) (<colgroup>) 定義表格中欄的群組。
command: command 元素代表使用者可呼喚的命令。
custom-element: 此元件不同於一般的 HTML5 元件，為客製化元件。因為此標籤不屬於 HTML5 ，無法自動檢查其語法或屬性的正確性。
datalist: The HTML Datalist Element (<datalist>) contains a set of <option> elements that represent the possible options for the value of other controls.
dd: The Definition Description Element (<dd>) indicates the definition of a term in a definition list (<dl>) element. This element can occur only as a child element of a definition list and it must follow a <dt> element.
del: The Deleted Text (<del>) HTML element represents a range of text that has been deleted from a document. This element is often (but need not be) rendered with strike-through text.
details: HTML 詳情 元素 (<details>) 用作一個可展開的元件，讓使用者可以從中取得額外資訊。
dfn: The Definition (<dfn>) HTML element represents the defining instance of a term.
div: The Document Division (<div>) HTML element is a generic container for flow content, which does not inherently represent anything. It can be used to group elements for styling purposes (using the class or id attributes), or because they share attribute values, such as lang. It should be used only when no other semantic element (such as <article> or <nav>) is appropriate.
dl: HTML Definition List （<dl>）元素 encloses a list of pairs of terms and descriptions。此元素的常見用法為implement a glossary.
dt: The HTML Definition Term Element (<dt>) identifies a term in a definition list. This element can occur only as a child element of a <dl>. It is usually followed by a <dd> element; however, multiple <dt> elements in a row indicate several terms that are all defined by the immediate next <dd> element.
em: The HTML Emphasis Element (<em>) marks text that has stress emphasis. The <em> element can be nested, with each level of nesting indicating a greater degree of emphasis.
embed: The HTML Embed Element (<embed>) represents an integration point for an external application or interactive content (in other words, a plug-in).
fieldset: The HTML element fieldset (<fieldset>) is used to group several controls as well as labels (<label>) within a web form.
figcaption: The HTML Figcaption Element (<figcaption>) represents a caption or a legend associated with a figure or an illustration described by the rest of the <figure> element. This element is optional.
figure: The HTML Figure Element (<figure>) represents self-contained content, frequently with a caption (<figcaption>), and is typically referenced as a single unit. While it is related to the main flow, its position is independent of the main flow. Usually this is an image, an illustration, a diagram, a code snippet, or a schema that is referenced in the main text, but that can be moved to another page or to an appendix without affecting the main flow.
footer: The HTML Footer Element (<footer>) represents a footer for its nearest sectioning content or sectioning root element (i.e, its nearest parent <article>, <aside>, <nav>, <section>, <blockquote>, <body>, <details>, <fieldset>, <figure>, <td>). A footer typically contains information about the author of the section, copyright data or links to related documents.
form: form （<form>）HTML元素代表文件有一部份含有讓使用者向網路伺服器提交資訊的互動式控件。
h1: Heading 元素具有六種文件標題體； <h1> 最為強調的而<h6>則反之。 heading元素簡要概述其引用之部分的主題。Heading 資訊可能為使用者代理程式所用。舉例來說，（代理程式）自動為文件架構目錄表。
head: HTML <head> 元素代表文件的一組詮釋資料（metadata），包含程式腳本和樣式表的連結或定義。
header: HTML 頁首元素 (<header>) 代表一組前言或是輔助導覽。它可以包含一些標題（heading）元素甚至其它元素像是一個 logo，內含段落（section）的 header，一個搜尋表單等等。
hgroup: The HTML Headings Group Element (<hgroup>) represents the heading of a section. It defines a single title that participates in the outline of the document as the heading of the implicit or explicit section that it belongs too.
hr: In HTML5 the <hr> element represents a thematic break between paragraph-level elements (for example, a change of scene in a story, or a shift of topic with a section). In previous versions of HTML, it represented a horizontal rule. It may still be displayed as a horizontal rule in visual browsers, but is now defined in semantic terms, rather than presentational terms.
html: The HTML root element (<html>) represents the root of an HTML or XHTML document. All other elements must be descendants of this element.
i: The HTML Offset Text (or Italics) Element (<i>) represents a range of text that is set off from the normal text for some reason, for example, technical terms, foreign language phrases, or fictional character thoughts. It is typically displayed in italic type.
iframe: The HTML inline frame element (<iframe>) represents a nested browsing context, effectively embedding another HTML page into the current page. Each browsing context has its own session history and active document. The browsing context that contains the embedded content is called the parent browsing context. The top-level browsing context (which has no parent) is typically the browser window.
input: input（<input>）元素用在基於web的表單中設計互動式控制元件。
ins: HTML <ins> 元素 (或 HTML 安插（Inserted）文字) 代表一段加入文件的文字。
kbd: The HTML Keyboard Input Element (<kbd>) produces an inline element displayed in the browser's default monotype font. This element is used to identify user input.
keygen: The HTML keygen element exists to facilitate generation of key material, and submission of the public key as part of an HTML form. This mechanism is designed for use with Web-based certificate management systems. It is expected that the keygen element will be used in an HTML form along with other information needed to construct a certificate request, and that the result of the process will be a signed certificate.
label: HTML 標識元素 (<label>) 代表介面中一個項目的說明文字。它可以使用 for 屬性和控制元件產生關聯，或者將控制元件元素放在 label 元素之中。這樣的控制元件稱為此標識元素的 被標識控制元件。
legend: The HTML Legend Field Element (<legend>) represents a caption for the content of its parent <fieldset>.
li: The HTML List item element (<li>) is used to represent a list item. It should be contained in an ordered list (<ol>), an unordered list (<ul>) or a menu (<menu>), where it represents a single entity in that list.
link: HTML Link Element （<link>） 指定目前的文件與其他文件之間的連繫。此元素可能的用途包含定義navigation的關係架構以及將文件連結至樣式表。
main: The HTML Main element (<main>) is used to indicate a document's main content. It contains contant that is directly related to, or expands upon the central topic of the document.
map: HTML Map 元素（<map>）用為與 <area> 元素來定義圖像地圖。
mark: The HTML Mark Element (<mark>) represents highlighted text, i.e., a run of text marked for reference purpose, due to its relevance in a particular context. For example it can be used in a page showing search results to highlight every instance of the searched for word.
menu: HTML的menu元素（<menu>）代表目錄選單或指令的未排序列表。
meta: The HTML Meta Element (<meta>) represents any metadata information which cannot be represented using one of the other meta-related element (<base>, <link>, <script>, <style> or <title>). According to the attributes set, the kind of metadata can be one of the following:
meter: HTML的meter元素（<meter>）代表已知範圍內的純量或者是fractional value.
nav: HTML 導覽（navigation）元素 (<nav>) 代表頁面中的一個段落，段落中的連結連往其它頁面或者是本頁的其它部分，亦即：一個包含導覽連結的段落。
noscript: HTML的NoScript元素（<noscript>）在網頁的腳本類型不被支援的時候，或是在瀏覽器中腳本目前為關閉時，定義一部分的html要被植入。
object: 嵌入式物件 (<object>) 元素代表一個外部的資源，它可以是一張圖片，一個巢狀式的瀏覽內容，或者一個需透過外掛程式來處理的資源。
ol: The HTML ordered list element (<ol>) represents an ordered list of items. Typically, ordered-list items are displayed with a preceding numbering, which can be of any form, like numerals, letters or Romans numerals or even simple bullets. This numbered style is not defined in the HTML description of the page, but in its associated CSS, using the list-style-type property.
optgroup: In a web form, the HTML optgroup element (<optgroup>) creates a grouping of options within a <select> element.
option: web 表單中 HTML option 元件 (<option>) 用於產生控制元件，其代表在 <select>之中的物件，是一種 <optgroup> 或是 <datalist> 的 HTML5 元件。
p: Paragraph元素（<p>）代表段落。為最常使用的區塊式元素。
pre: 此元素代表定型文字。此元素中的文字通常會顯示為非對稱字型 exactly as it is laid out in the file。此元素中的空格 are displayed as typed。
progress: HTML 進度 (<progress>) 元素用來檢視任務的完成進度。進度的顯示方式由網頁開發者決定，不過它通常以進度列來顯示。
q: quote 元素說明裡面的文字為一段簡短的內建引文。
s: The HTML Strikethrough Element (<s>) renders text with a strike-through, or a line through it. Use the <s> element to represent things that are no longer relevant or no longer accurate. However, <s> is not appropriate when indicating document edits; for that, use the <del> and <ins> elements, as appropriate.
samp: The HTML Sample Text Element (<samp>) produces an inline element displayed in the browser's default monotype font (Lucida Console). This element was intended to identify sample output from a computer program.
script: 腳本（script）元素用於將可執行的腳本嵌入或是連結在<abbr>HTML</abbr> 或 <abbr>XHTML</abbr> 文件中。
section: The HTML Section Element (<section>) represents a generic section of a document, i.e., a thematic grouping of content, typically with a heading.
select: The select (<select>) HTML element represents a control that presents menu of options. The options within the menu are represented by <option> elements, which can be grouped by <optgroup> elements. Options can be pre-selected for the user.
small: HTML 小號 (<small>) 元素讓文字的字體（font size）小一級 (例如從大到中、或是從小到特小) 直到瀏覽器的最小字級為止。
source: The source element is used to specify multiple media resources for audio and video elements in HTML5. It is an empty element. It is commonly used to serve the same media in multiple formats supported by different browsers.
span: This HTML element is a generic inline container for phrasing content, which does not inherently represent anything. It can be used to group elements for styling purposes (using the class or id attributes), or because they share attribute values, such as lang. It should be used only when no other semantic element is appropriate. <span> is very much like a <div> element, but <div> is a block-level element whereas a <span> is an inline element.
strong: HTML 強調元素 (<strong>) 讓文字被強調出來，通常是以粗體來呈現。
style: 樣式（style）元素內包含文件的樣式資訊。樣式資訊通常是以 CSS (詳見 CSS) 語言的形式寫在裡面。
sub: The HTML 下標（Subscript）元素 (<sub>) 定義一段需要在排版上標註在下方的文字，它的位置較低，字體常較主要文字小。
summary: HTML 摘要(<summary>) 元素代表了詳情（<details>）元素內容的摘要或說明。
sup: The HTML 上標（Superscript）元素 (<sup>) 定義一段需要在排版上標註在上方的文字，它的位置較高，字體常較主要文字小。
table: HTML的表格元素 （<table>）代表以二維或更高維度呈現的資料。
tbody: The HTML Table Body Element (<tbody>) defines a set of rows defining the body of the table. Though not mandatory, as the rows of the body can be defined as <tr> elements children of the parent <table> element, if present, all <tr> elements part of the body must be included into a unique <tbody> element.
td: HTML Table Cell Element（<td>）定義內有資料的表格。
textarea: HTML 文字區塊 (<textarea>) 元素代表多行的純文字編輯控制元件。
tfoot: HTML 表尾（Table Foot）元素 (<tfoot>) 定義一組表格列用以總結表格的各個欄位。
th: HTML 表格標題儲存格元素 (Table Header Cell Element，<th>) 定義一組儲存格的標題儲存格。屬於此標題儲存格的儲存格群組可透過scope 和 headers屬性來指定。
thead: HTML 表首（Table Head）元素 (<thead>) 定義一組表格列用以在表首代表各個欄位的定義。
time: HTML 時間元素 (<time>) 代表 24 小時制的時間或是精確的公曆（Gregorian calendar）日期 (可選擇性地加上時間和時區資訊) 。
title: HTML的Title元素（<title>）定義文件的標題，顯示於瀏覽器的標題列或顯示在分頁。只能包含文字且任何被寫入的標籤皆不為解釋。
tr: HTML 表格列元素 (Table Row Element，<tr>) 定義表格中的一列儲存格。表格列中的元素可以是<td> 或者 <th>。
u: HTML 底線元素 (Underline Element，<u>) 在內含的文字底下加上底線，底線會位在文字底部的下方處。
ul: HTML 無序清單 (Unordered List，<ul>) 代表一組未排序的清單項目，也就是一組沒有數字次序的項目集合，因此項目在清單中的位置不代表先後順序。通常未排序的清單項目前面會搭配一個點、圓圈、或者方塊等不同形式的項目符號。項目符號的樣式不會定義在 HTML 頁面的描述中，而是透過 CSS 的list-style-type 屬性來指定。
var: HTML 變數（variable）元素 (<var>) 代表一個數學表示式或是程式文本中的變數。
video: HTML 視訊元素（<video>）代表嵌入在 HTML 或 XHTML 文件中的視訊。
wbr: 斷字時機（Word Break Opportunity） (<wbr>) HTML 元素所處在文字中的位置，讓瀏覽器可以在這個位置斷行，可用在瀏覽器斷行規則不會斷行的地方。
